<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Eye for Treasure](/Feats.aspx?ID=1398) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Dwarf" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=54" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 42 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You know good artisanship when you see it and can wax poetic about crafting techniques and forms. You become trained in [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) and gain a +1 circumstance bonus on all Crafting checks made to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26). If you would automatically become trained in Crafting (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. In addition, you gain the [Crafter's Appraisal](/Feats.aspx?ID=2118) skill feat, enabling you to identify magic items using the Crafting skill.
name: Eye for Treasure
